description:
You are given an array a, you have to arrange the elements of array a in such a way that they create a wave meaning that, ar[0]>=ar[1]<=ar[2]>=ar[3].....ar[n-2]>=ar[n-1].

#### Note: </br>
```
You have to solve this question in O(1) space complexity and O(n) Time complexity.
```

Input Format

The first line contains a single integer denoting the size of the array.

The second line contains n space separated integers denoting the elements of the array.

Output Format

Print the wave array that you have formed where the integers are separated by space.


#### Sample Input:
```
5
1 2 3 4 5
```
#### Sample Output:
```
2 1 4 3 5
```

#### Explanation: </br>
```
The elements are in a wave when ar[0]>=ar[1]<=ar[2]>=ar[3]<=ar[4] , thus [2 1 4 3 5] fulfils that condition.

```
#### Constraints:

- `1<=n<=10^6`
- `1<=a[i]<=10^8`
title: Wave array
